answers.answer: Free medical care and medical assistance are available for people fleeing the war in Ukraine. This includes free medical consultations from a family doctor, therapist, or pediatrician, as well as access to some medical services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: IOM Romania provides free medical care. The Ukrainian clinic MedZirka offers free online and offline medical services. Additionally, Red Cross Romania, with support from the French Red Cross, opened a Health Promotion Center offering free medical consultations and access to some medical services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The offered medical services include free medical care and assistance. Specifically, free consultations from a family doctor, therapist, or pediatrician are available, and refugees can access some medical services through the Red Cross's Health Promotion Center.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The provided content does not specify when refugees can access these medical services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Refugees can find more information about available medical care by following the 'Read more' links provided for each organization mentioned on the page. For MedZirka, a declaration needs to be filled to get consultations.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care and read the page carefully.
